snippet.textDisplay:
I think the Olive Garden thing was supposed to be tongue in cheek. A joke on blatant product placement.

Although, as a Government contractor, I can 100% confirm that they give you $50 gift cards to rando places as shows of appreciation. I've gotten Home Depot, Honey Baked Ham, Friday's, Noodles and Co...
snippet.textOriginal:
I think the Olive Garden thing was supposed to be tongue in cheek.  A joke on blatant product placement.

Although, as a Government contractor, I can 100% confirm that they give you $50 gift cards to rando places as shows of appreciation.  I've gotten Home Depot, Honey Baked Ham, Friday's, Noodles and Co...

snippet.textDisplay: see this movie after you blazz.. i fucking loved it.. alot a cool shit in it.. the sonics home world looked so good. robotnic was awesome.. everything from the game was very well explained for its adaption to a movie. something small i noticed that might just be me who sees this but, sonics gloves look more real then the rest of his cgi body.. sonic looks great aswell but the fact his gloves look like they are 100% real and they are infront of him visually it almost helps trick your eyes a step further past him being a cgi character and assists in perceiving him more real.. that was a.. nice touch cause when im high i can sometimes look for flaws that ruin a movie .. but with this movie i had alot of fun and was constantly smiling from ear to ear

snippet.textDisplay: I'd love to see an adaptation of Metroid but as a TV show like Castlevania since Nintendo has a lot of source material to deal with, has an interesting character (a badass female bounty hunter who's struggling with PTSD because Ridley was responsible for killing her parents), and it would be interesting to watch as a developing series rather than crammed into a two hour or so movie.
snippet.textOriginal: I'd love to see an adaptation of Metroid but as a TV show like Castlevania since Nintendo has a lot of source material to deal with, has an interesting character (a badass female bounty hunter who's struggling with PTSD because Ridley was responsible for killing her parents), and it would be interesting to watch as a developing series rather than crammed into a two hour or so movie.

snippet.textDisplay: I feel like it could have been so much more. They should have introduced Robotik first to develop his character in tandem with Sonic then build the tension between Sonic and Robotik by having Robotniks love of his life (maybe a robot he created) to die while on an excursion to find Sonic. Robotnik blames the death wrongfully on Sonic and his hate turns to motivation and obsession to capture Sonic. Although this is a children's movie, no romance was displayed, (I don't believe James Marsden or Tika Sumpter kissed once) something commonly found in Disney movies. The pacing is extremely slow, something I did not expect from a movie about a speedster. Also the music is uninspiring. Maybe a synth pop/drum and bass remix of the game soundtrack would have been appropriate and bring a sense of nostalgia to the older crowd. I think Sega missed its chance to create a movie/tv empire by playing it safe. Golden Axe, Altered Beast, Phantasy Star, Streets of Rage, Crazy Taxi, Ecco the Dolphin, Shinobi. If you are creating a Sonic the Hedgehog movie you are already taking a risk, might as well go all out.
snippet.textOriginal: I feel like it could have been so much more. They should have introduced Robotik first to develop his character in tandem with Sonic then build the tension between Sonic and Robotik by having Robotniks love of his life (maybe a robot he created) to die while on an excursion to find Sonic. Robotnik blames the death wrongfully on Sonic and his hate turns to motivation and obsession to capture Sonic. Although this is a children's movie, no romance was displayed, (I don't believe James Marsden or Tika Sumpter kissed once) something commonly found in Disney movies. The pacing is extremely slow, something I did not expect from a movie about a speedster. Also the music is uninspiring. Maybe a synth pop/drum and bass remix of the game soundtrack would have been appropriate and bring a sense of nostalgia to the older crowd. I think Sega missed its chance to create a movie/tv empire by playing it safe. Golden Axe, Altered Beast, Phantasy Star, Streets of Rage, Crazy Taxi, Ecco the Dolphin, Shinobi. If you are creating a Sonic the Hedgehog movie you are already taking a risk, might as well go all out.

snippet.textDisplay:
This movie was pretty much what it was supposed to be. A fun time for the family.
Personally, I would've preferred that a Sonic movie be a CGI animated film (I always find it a bit strange or hit and miss whenever they mix in CG cartoony characters with Live action actors) but that's just my personal opinion. By no means does it take away from this particular film, and I like Marsden and how he interacted with Sonic. Carrey's performance is a bit of a hit and miss. I find it a bit strange that he's the one that gets the praise when he's really just playing Jim Carrey, which isn't bad in itself, just tired and overdone in my opinion. When it comes to manic performances I personally think Nicholas Cage does it best. But I digress.
Overall it's an enjoyable movie if you know what you're in for.
snippet.textOriginal:
This movie was pretty much what it was supposed to be. A fun time for the family. 
Personally, I would've preferred that a Sonic movie be a CGI animated film (I always find it a bit strange or hit and miss whenever they mix in CG cartoony characters with Live action actors) but that's just my personal opinion. By no means does it take away from this particular film, and I like Marsden and how he interacted with Sonic. Carrey's performance is a bit of a hit and miss. I find it a bit strange that he's the one that gets the praise when he's really just playing Jim Carrey, which isn't bad in itself, just tired and overdone in my opinion. When it comes to manic performances I personally think Nicholas Cage does it best. But I digress. 
Overall it's an enjoyable movie if you know what you're in for.

snippet.textDisplay: I did like the film, but I wish it was better. It was fun, delightful and entertaining. I just wish there was more emotional weight between Marsden and Sonic. If you look at Who Framed Roger Rabbit, Eddie and Roger grow a real friendship. Eddie is opening up more, he’s trusting toons again, and I wish that was in the film. Also the human characters didn’t have any growth to them, they were the same all the way through the film. My biggest problem was Jim Carrey doing 90’s Jim Carrey again. We know he’s a capable actor and I wish the director and he tried a different approach to Eggman. Also two scenes in the film looked ripped right out of the X-men quicksilver scenes. It’s the “oh look I’m moving super fast that time slows down” bit. We’ve seen it quiet a bit now and I wish they found a way to make it their own. That being said, I do recommend it highly and take the kids. I also appreciate that it wasn’t endless farts and bathroom humor which usually plague these kind of films.
snippet.textOriginal: I did like the film, but I wish it was better. It was fun, delightful and entertaining. I just wish there was more emotional weight between Marsden and Sonic. If you look at Who Framed Roger Rabbit, Eddie and Roger grow a real friendship. Eddie is opening up more, he’s trusting toons again, and I wish that was in the film. Also the human characters didn’t have any growth to them, they were the same all the way through the film. My biggest problem was Jim Carrey doing 90’s Jim Carrey again. We know he’s a capable actor and I wish the director and he tried a different approach to Eggman. Also two scenes in the film looked ripped right out of the X-men quicksilver scenes. It’s the “oh look I’m moving super fast that time slows down” bit. We’ve seen it quiet a bit now and I wish they found a way to make it their own. That being said, I do recommend it highly and take the kids. I also appreciate that it wasn’t endless farts and bathroom humor which usually plague these kind of films.

snippet.textDisplay:
Hollywood must be careful with those kind of products. Videogames are taking over the whole industry, with good stories, good cinematics and so on. So if they are going to adapt a videogame to a movie, they should do exactly the same as the videogame itself with some little tinny variants, if they want to, but keeping the spirit, so it is not necessary at all to change anything. If you don't do this. You will screw Up the whole thing.

Happy that at least, they listen to the fans
snippet.textOriginal:
Hollywood must be careful with those kind of products. Videogames are taking over the whole industry, with good stories, good cinematics and so on. So if they are going to adapt a videogame to a movie, they should do exactly the same as the videogame itself with some little tinny variants, if they want to, but keeping the spirit, so it is not necessary at all to change anything. If you don't do this. You will screw Up the whole thing.

Happy that at least, they listen to the fans

snippet.textDisplay:
"Doesn't treat kids like they're dumb"

It's full of exposition dumping through narration and dialogue when the visuals do more than enough to convey the same information

It was fun, though it feels so close to Alvin and the Chipmunks and Hop. It's such a committee-created piece of art that it feels like someone could've pitched this as another movie and the execs thought, "hey we have Sonic's film rights, just make it that." The issues with the movie are more issues with kid's movies in general, having cookie-cutter interactions and story beats
snippet.textOriginal:
"Doesn't treat kids like they're dumb"

It's full of exposition dumping through narration and dialogue when the visuals do more than enough to convey the same information

It was fun, though it feels so close to Alvin and the Chipmunks and Hop. It's such a committee-created piece of art that it feels like someone could've pitched this as another movie and the execs thought, "hey we have Sonic's film rights, just make it that." The issues with the movie are more issues with kid's movies in general, having cookie-cutter interactions and story beats
